column1: Tevildo was the "Prince of Cats" in The Tale of Tinúviel. He appeared in the form of a great black Cats with a collar of gold. During the Quest for the Silmaril
column2: Beren was captured by Melko and sent as a servant to Tevildo. However the cat was defeated by Huan and Lúthien when they forced him to reveal the spell which held the stones of his castle together and which held cats under his evil sway. When his collar was removed the other cats shrunk.

column1: Later Tevildos place in the narrative was replaced by that of the Necromancer
column3: in the legendarium. Thû (and later Sauron) was the "Lord of Werewolves"
column4: in contrast to Tevildos position as "Prince of Cats"; the cat-versus-dog theme prominent in the Tale of Tinúviel was thus eliminated in later writings.

column1: The name is Qenya. Although it is not given a literal translation
column2: it is said to derive from the root TEFE signifying hate or hatred. His Gnomish name is Tifil.

column1: The title of "Prince of Cats" had also been used for the character Tybalt from William Shakespeares Romeo and Juliet.
Category:Characters in The Book of Lost Tales
